author: James Cymbryla

review: Love my apple tv. Has made watching things from the internet SO much easier.I only really use it for Netflix, and occasionally YouTube, but there are other apps that you can use.People with MULTIPLE APPLE PRODUCTS should get this over another smart device. You can airplay from your iMac, macbook, iPhone, iPad, iPod touch. So if you want to use it as a second monitor for your computer, do it. If you want to show your friends or family pictures from your latest vacation, do it. If you want to have a bigger screen than your phone when playing a game from the app store, or you want to see what your edited video project will look like on a tv, just airplay. AIRPLAY AIRPLAY AIRPLAY.Only thing I really dislike is that the remote from the apple tv will also work with your mac computers. There is a way to turn it off though.
author: Esteban

review: It's Apple TV, it works, it is easy to setup (especially if you have an IOS7 iPhone).I put this on the TV in our bedroom so now I have NetFlix, WatchABC and access to my iTunes on my PC (yes you have to launch iTunes on your PC to have it show up).Setup was super easy, if you have an iPhone or iPad running IOS7 you can just turn the Apple TV on, turn on the BlueTooth on your iPhone, lay your iPhone down on the Apple TV box and your phone automates the install process! Type in your Apple ID password and confirm that you want to setup the TV and BAM! The Apple TV is setup with your wifi password and iTunes account info.Simple as can be!The only thing missing from the Apple TV options (for me) was Amazon (not surprising since they compete) but it's easy enough to run the Amazon Instant Video app on my iPhone and use Airplay to shoot it over to the Apple TV. The recent addition of WatchABC is awesome and now gives me ABC On Demand in our bedroom (we have a bare minimum cable box in there).I would also suggest installing the Apple TV Remote app on your iPhone/iPad/iPod Touch.
